column3: Tourism;A pair of Wigan nurses have finally returned to the UK from Cambodia after being stranded there following the Covid-19 outbreak.------Elaine Morley and Diane Tomlinson
column4: from Appley Bridge and Wigan respectively
column5: were enjoying the trip of a lifetime with colleagues Val Travis and Anna Williams
column6: travelling across Asia since the start of the month.------The group
column8: were due to return home on March 23
column9: until the Covid-19 pandemic grounded flights out of Cambodia to Britain. All further attempts to get home had been unsuccessful
column10: with flight after flight cancelled. They had no idea when they would be able to return home and found themselves quickly running out of cash.------But on Tuesday evening
column11: after maxing out credit cards and spending thousands of pounds on cancelled plane tickets
column12: Elaine and Diane finally returned safely to the UK after an arduous journey home
column13: first flying to Doha in Qatar and then onwards to Britain. They travelled home separately from friends Val and Anna
column15: Liverpool. The latter duo bagged the last two seats on a Qatar Airways flight
column16: and were also due to arrive home yesterday morning.------Elaine said: “We left the UK on March 1
column17: starting off in Vietnam. Before we left
column18: we were told everything was fine
column19: we could still come and there was nothing stopping us. We asked the travel agents and insurance company
column21: they said it was fine to still go
column22: so of course we did.------“We had 12 nights in Vietnam
column24: travelling around for two to three nights in various places.”------The group were due to return home on an Emirates flight on Monday March 23
column25: but their flight had been cancelled. Frantic efforts to contact the airline were unsuccessful.------After speaking to the British Embassy
column26: they each paid £900 to book their seats on the plane
column27: but within half an hour the booking was cancelled
column28: and they were told it could be up to six weeks before they were refunded.------A Foreign Office spokesperson
column29: said: “We recognize British tourists abroad are finding it difficult to return to the UK because of the unprecedented international travel and domestic restrictions that are being introduced around the world – often with very little or no notice.”------ WIGAN TODAY
